Dexter Tiah, Founder at Whatcard.sgLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 20 Jun 2019Cyclical stocks have more earnings during the growth stage of the business cycle. They may then be able to give more dividends. So to answer your question, invest in the stock of listed cyclical companies which the management explicitly said they will increase pay out or that has a consistent track record of increasing dividends when entering a growth cycle0 comments1
